content: परस्पर {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Mutual; परस्परां विस्मयवंति लक्ष्मीमालोकयांचक्रुरिवादरेण <ls>Bk. 2. 5.</ls> {%--<ab>pron. a.</ab>%} Each other, one another (used in the <ab>sing.</ab> only; often in <ab>comp.</ab>); परस्परस्योपरि पर्यचीयत <ls>R. 3. 24</ls>; <ls n="R.">7. 38</ls>; अविज्ञातपरस्परैः अपसर्पैः <ls n="R.">17. 51</ls>; परस्पराक्षिसादृक्ष्यं <ls n="R.">1. 40</ls>, <ls n="R.">3. 24.</ls> {%Note%}. The <ab>acc.</ab> and <ab>abl.</ab> singulars are often used adverbially in the sense of ‘mutually,’ ‘reciprocally’, ‘one another,’ ‘by, from, or to one another’, ‘against one another’ &c.; see <ls>Bg. 3. 11</ls>, <ls n="Bg.">10. 9</ls>; <ls>R. 4. 79</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 46</ls>; <ls n="R.">7. 14</ls>, <ls n="R. 7.">53</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 94.</ls>
